text: granny and I wish you a Happy Mother's
Day hey guys its Angel today I'm back in
the kitchen with my grandma and she is
going to help us make a Taiwanese
braised beef shank now my grandma's
still a little bit camera shy but she
loves making braised meats like pork
belly or braised beef so she's
volunteered to help me today grandma do
you want to come say hello hello No
so we're going to be making a braised
beef shank which is traditionally served
cold as an appetizer and I've partnered
with Pearl River Bridge sauces to make
this delicious Taiwanese specialty into
a video recipe for you guys so with that
I'll get my Graham up here and let's get
cooking now for the ingredients let's
start with the fresh ingredients first
prepare two to three stalks of green
onions cut into large sections and don't
worry about them being meat because
they'll dissolve when we braise them
will also need a three inch piece of
ginger cut into smaller medallion pieces
and when you're done they should look
like this next preheat a heavy saucepan
with the tiny bit of oil then add the
ginger and green onions stir fry for a
bit then add two whole star nice and
stir-fried more to help release the
fragrance of the spice
next add our meat we're using roughly
two pounds of whole beef shank then add
half a teaspoon of five-spice powder two
tablespoons of rock sugar 1/2 a cup of
Pearl River Bridge superior light soy
sauce 2 tablespoons of Pearl River
Bridge mushroom flavored dark soy sauce
to give it a bit of mommy flavor quarter
cup of rice wine or you can substitute
with a dry sherry and finally add enough
filtered water to just barely cover the
beef shank next bring everything to a
boil then reduce to a simmer and cover
if you'd like simmer and cook the beef
for two hours turning every 30 minutes
or so if needed to ensure an even
braising after 2 hours or when the meat
is tender let the beef cool to the touch
before cutting or you can refrigerate
the meat for a few hours and serve it
chilled before slicing which makes it
easier to cut into thin slices
finally arrange the slices neatly on a
plate and top with a spoonful or two of
the braising liquid and some optional
cilantro for garnish then sir
of course when you're slicing I'm sure
you'll be tempted to sample a bite or
two like me
so that's how easy it is to make a
Taiwanese braised beef shank now as I
mentioned before this is traditionally
served cold as an appetizer but you can
also serve it in so many other ways that
it can definitely make multiple meals
some ideas are serving it sliced over
Bowl hot noodles for our hot soup and
also for the traditional and very
popular Taiwanese beef rolls served with
sliced cucumbers I hope you guys enjoyed
this video don't forget to give me a
thumbs up and subscribe to my channel
angel Wong's kitchen for more authentic
Asian recipes made simple and fun a big
thank you from me and my grandma for
watching and we'll see you guys soon bye
buh bye
